Optimization Problem:This problem involves finding the best solution among a set of feasible solutions, in this case, minimizing the total amount of gas consumed while delivering 1000 pieces of mail.
Constraint:A condition that must be satisfied in order to find a valid solution. In this case, the constraint is that at least 50% of the trips must be made by speed boats.
Linear Programming:A mathematical method used to determine a way to achieve the best outcome in a given mathematical model. In this case, we can use linear programming to optimize the number of trips made by regular and speed boats to minimize gas consumption.
